attributes.action: instruct the responsible Minister to block the Halifax television adverts
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Halifax bank, a subsidiary of HBOS and LLoydsTSB - now majority owned by the UK taxpayer - has engaged in a series of television adverts based around a mock radio station that have been almost universally ridiculed and derided by the general public.

Adverts such as this can only have the effect of reducing customer satisfaction with the Bank, which in turn has a negative impact on the taxpayer's investment in the company.

We ask the Prime Minister to instruct the responsible Minister or department to exercise shareholder prerogatives and seek an urgent termination of this damaging advertising campaign before the taxpayer suffers any further losses.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Halifax.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
